abstract: Video posted on YouTube appears to show decapitated body of Haruna Yukawa, Japanese hostage of Islamic State; Japan's Prime Min Shinzo Abe condemns apparent killing and demands immediate release of second hostage Kenji Goto as United States and Japanese governments work to authenticate video.
lead_paragraph: Japan’s prime minister on Sunday condemned the apparent killing by the Islamic State of the hostage as an “outrageous and unforgivable act of violence,” and demanded the immediate release of a second hostage.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rod Nordland from Amman, Jordan; Anne Barnard, Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Rukmini Callimachi from San Diego; Hisako Ueno from Tokyo; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Rick Gladstone from New York.

snippet: Japan’s prime minister on Sunday condemned the apparent killing by the Islamic State of the hostage as an “outrageous and unforgivable act of violence,” and demanded the immediate release of a second hostage.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Video Appears to Show Decapitated Body of a Japanese Hostage of ISIS
headline.print_headline: Video Appears to Show Decapitated Body of a Japanese Hostage of ISIS
